fields.description:
we have a workflow where PRs are made pointing to master, reviewed, and approved. They are collected until it is time to put together a release (software is fairly legacy, and does not have a pipeline automated). At this time, feature branch is manually rebased onto the release branch, and squash merged into it. 

At time of release, this feature branch gets squash merged into master. 

This gives us a good history, but the issue we have is an ever growing list of open PRs that are not really open. the code has been merged, just not through the UI, and not before being rebased and added to a different branch. 

Because of this, we have a ton of dead PRs that are sitting open, with NO WAY to mark them as merged. This is creating a messy situation for us.
fields.summary: Add feature for users to manually change the status of a Pull Request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a user has access to repositories via a Group and they leave one of the group accessible repositories they are subsequently removed from the Group and workspace.

The workspace audit log does not have any indication that the user has left the repository and in turn, is removed from the group and workspace.

The audit log should reflect this activity so that admins can understand why a user no longer has access to a workspace and the repositories.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# User is invited to a workspace group, the group has access to multiple repositories 
# The invited user leaves one of the group accessible repositories
# The user is removed from the workspace and Group
# The workspace audit log has no indication of what happened

h3. Expected Results
* The Audit log should record this event indicating the user has left a group accessible repository and in turn has been removed from the workspace and group

h3. Actual Results
* This activity is missing from the audit log as if the events never happened

h3. Workaround
* Re-invite the user back to the group so they can access the repositories again
fields.summary: Add logging to Audit log when user chooses to leave a repository and is subsequently removed from a Group and workspace

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you try editing an issue tracker comment with a mentioned user, it breaks the UI.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a new comment in an issue tracker and mention someone
 # Click *Edit*

h3. Expected Results
The UI will not break

h3. Actual Results
The UI is broken upon clicking the Edit button
 !issue_edit_breaks_mention.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Editing an issue tracker comment breaks the UI for mention

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When you navigate to a Bitbucket url using the Repository UUID, we do not convert that url into a human readable repository slug.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Navigate to any Bitbucket URL using the UUID, e.g. http://bitbucket.org/\{workspace-uuid}/\{repo-uuid}/branch/master
 # See that the url is not rewritten to the human readable version

h3. Expected Results

The url in the address bar would be replaced with something like: http://bitbucket.org/my-workspace/repository-foo/branch/master
fields.summary: Rewrite the repo UUID into a human readable slug in the address bar

fields.description:
While using the "custom" option to trigger builds in Bitbucket Cloud, we would like to be able to select the branch that will be cloned during this process similar to the way that builds triggered by the "branches:" section does.

eg.

{code}
pipelines:
  custom:
    clone-master:
      - step: Clone-Master 
           script:
            - echo "Do something with a master branch clone"
  branches:
    master:
      - step: 
          name: Master trigger
          script:
            - echo "Master branch is cloned during build set up"
{code}
fields.summary: Ability to select the branch that will be cloned during the build setup step for "custom" builds

fields.description:
Bitbucket Pipes (https://bitbucket.org/product/features/pipelines/integrations) are implemented in Pipelines, which means that they are not something that is recognized by bash as an executable.

This means that it's not possible to condition the execution of a Pipe command with an "if" during a build execution.

This feature request is to add the ability to condition the Pipe from running only if give conditions (like environment variables being a certain value for example) are true.
fields.summary: Ability to condition the execution of Bitbucket Pipe sections in steps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While adding new SSH keys to the personal account no logs entries are being added to the Audit log page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create an SSH key 
 # Add the SSH key to the personal account

h3. Expected Results

An entry of the addition of new SSH key added to the Audit log page

h3. Actual Results

No entry is added to the Audit log page

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior besides checking the SSH page for SSH keys that are currently linked to the personal account (Does not include the IP address from which it was added)
fields.summary: Addition of new SSH keys is not being logged

fields.description:
The currently available `/2.0/repositories/\{workspace}/\{repo_slug}/pipelines/\{pipeline_uuid}/steps/\{step_uuid}/log` endpoint provides the complete log-text for the given pipeline-step, this is useful. But it doesn't allow to differentiate between logs generated by different commands. It would be very useful to know which part of the logs is coming from which command.
 * It would be great to have an API to get the log of each script-command separately like we see in the Bitbucket pipelines UI where the logs are separated by the command which generates it.

Also, the API doesn't return logs generated by services. For example, if I have docker service in my step, the API doesn't return logs generated by docker service.
 * It would be great if the API can return the service logs as well.
fields.summary: Please provide an API endpoint to get separate logs for each script-command in pipelines step and also return the service logs
A pipeline feature that can be configured in the yaml file to skip some steps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
With [new ITSM feature on JSD|https://bitbucket.org/blog/a-modern-approach-to-change-management-with-bitbucket-and-jira-service-desk], additional field - "deployment_gate_enabled" is added to Pipelines' deployment environment.

However, this field can be updated through API ([/2.0/repositories/<workspace>/<repo_slug>/environments/ | https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/environments/]) even thou the repository is not linked to Jira's ITSM project.
This will *block Pipelines build* from deploying to the environment with the "Change request pending" prompt.
 !image-2020-10-27-09-11-53-996.png|thumbnail! 

In addition to it, it's not possible for users to check or toggle the deployment gating flag on Deployment Settings to continue with the build

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run the API [/2.0/repositories/<workspace>/<repo_slug>/environments/ | https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/environments/] with the following payload
{code}
{
      "deployment_gate_enabled": true,
      "environment_type": {
        "type": "deployment_environment_type",
        "name": "Test",
        "rank": 0
      },
      "name": "Test"
    }
{code}
(i) Repo shouldn't connect to any Jira ITSM project while reproducing the issue
 # Navigate to "Repository Settings>Deployment" and there's no option for users to toggle off the deployment gating flag
 !image-2020-10-27-09-14-06-333.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
"deployment_gating" flag auto-set as "*false*" if the repo is not linked to Jira ITSM project or Jira criteria are not met.

h3. Actual Results
The API request able to parse  "deployment_gate_enabled" as true, which will block Pipelines build to deploy to the specific deployment environment.
And there's no option on UI for users to turn off the feature for the deployment environment.

h3. Workaround
* UI: Re-add the deployment environment through UI
* API: Run API to delete the deployment environment, then run POST request the add new deployment environment with the  "deployment_gate_enabled" field as "false"
fields.summary: Able to use API to update "deployment_gate_enabled" flag without Jira integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Log in to Bitbucket in Chrome private mode (Incognito mode) gives "The page isn't working, _ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS_" error page for a short time, and then login happens successfully without any issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Log in to Bitbucket via bitbucket.org
 # Specify email address and password associated with Bitbucket account

h3. Expected Results

The Bitbucket dashboard should be opened without any issue
h3. Actual Results

There is a page with "The page isn't working, _ERR_TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS_" error for a short time, and then the Bitbucket dashboard page opens
h3. Workaround

Log in to Bitbucket in normal mode instead of Chrome Private (Incognito) mode
fields.summary: Login to Bitbucket in Chrome private mode gives "TOO_MANY_REDIRECTS" error for short time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The new PR experience is unable to show diff for non-image LFS files, and it only shows the "lfs oid" changes 
In compares to the "Compare" page (https://bitbucket.org/<WorkspaceID>/<Repo>/branches/compare/), it able to show that the Git LFS changes.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
(i) With the above image, the left column is the "Compare" page while the right column is the Pull Request view

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to https://bitbucket.org/account/settings/features/
# Enable "New pull request experience" feature
# Add/Replace an LFS file on a Source Branch
# Create Pull Request to merge the Source Branch

h3. Expected Results
It's expected that both diff from "Compare" page and "Pull Request(New PR experience)" remains the same, and the PR able to indicate the LFS file changes.

h3. Actual Results
The new pull request experience views only show the LFS's "oid" and the "size" diff

h3. Workaround
Viewing the change on the "Branch Compare" page or disabling the new PR experience.
fields.summary: New PR experience doesn't support non-image LFS files

fields.description:
Hi,

I use an on-premise sonarqube instance to mesure code quality.

When i do a PR, sonar analyse code quality/bug/.... and create a report on Bitbucket PR.

 

Is to possible to add a "merge check" based on this report result?
fields.summary: Use report result as merge check

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you add a table in an issue tracker comment, the table data/format is broken

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an existing issue tracker
# Add a table with the values below
**  !issue_tracker_comment_before.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The table will be formatted correctly along with the values

h3. Actual Results
The table is not formatted correctly and the values are broken
 !issue_tracker_comment_after.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue tracker comment table format is broken after saving

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Markdown tables very much differ from their preview view when compared to the actual results in the PR body.

As an example, the following table should have each of its columns with different alignments:
{code}
right aligned | left aligned and long | center aligned
--:|--------------|:--:
1.|Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.|stuffs
2.|Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.|stuffs
3.|Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.|stuffs
{code}

When checking the preview view, the following can be seen, which is the expected behavior for this table:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-22 at 16.35.20.png|thumbnail! 

When actually creating the PR and checking the table, however, the formatting will always be left-aligned:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-22 at 16.36.45.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new PR;
 # In the description, add the following Markdown table for example:
{code}
right aligned | left aligned and long | center aligned
--:|--------------|:--:
1.|Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.|stuffs
2.|Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.|stuffs
3.|Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit.|stuffs
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The expectation, in this case, is for the rendered table to align the columns just like the preview view does, like this:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-22 at 16.35.20.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The rendered table will always be rendered with left-aligned columns:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-22 at 16.36.45.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Incorrect alignment on Markdown tables on PR description

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a pipeline fails users will receive an email notification. In the body of the email, there is a button "View this pipeline" to click to view the pipeline question. When the button is clicked on a Firefox browser a new tab opens attempting to redirect to the pipeline but it never loads. There are curly brackets in the URL '{}' around the pipeline UUID and this prevents the page from loading

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Trigger a pipeline build that fails
# An email is sent indicating the build failed
# Access the email on a Firefox browser
# In the email click the "View this pipeline" button
# You're redirected to the pipeline but the page will not load
# The URL contains brackets around the pipeline UUID
Example:
{code:java}
https://bitbucket.org/SameWorksapce/SampleRepo/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/{469bd088-0db0-4734-822b-f3e239f7e30f}
{code}

h3. Expected Results
* The page should load the pipeline in question

h3. Actual Results
* Page does not complete loading

h3. Workaround
* Open the link on a browser other than Firefox
* If other browsers are not available. Remove the brackets in the URL
Example:
{code:java}
https://bitbucket.org/SameWorksapce/SampleRepo/addon/pipelines/home#!/results/469bd088-0db0-4734-822b-f3e239f7e30f
{code}
fields.summary: Clicking on a failed pipeline email to view the pipeline does not load on Firefox

fields.description:
While running the API call 
* https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bnode%7D/statuses/build

We have a limitation that stop us from using more than 40 characters:

eg. 
{code}
{"type": "error", "error": {"fields": {"key": ["Ensure this value has at most 40 characters (it has 65)."]}, "message": "key: Ensure this value has at most 40 characters (it has 65)."}}%
{code}

We would like to have a bigger limit as it is necessary for us to properly run our API calls.
fields.summary: Increase the limit of characters in the API call

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, there is no Pipeline variable for the Pull request and description as per [this|https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/variables-and-secrets/] documentation. These variables can be helpful to retrieve the information of Pull request where the current Pipeline build is triggering. 
h3. Expected Results

There should be support for the Pull request name and description Pipeline variables
h3. Actual Results

There is not support for Pull request name and description Pipeline variables
h3. Workaround

Use the following API to get the information about the Pull request name and description. More information about this API can be found in [this|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/pullrequests/%7Bpull_request_id%7D] API documentation link.
{code:java}
/2.0/repositories/{workspace}/{repo_slug}/pullrequests/{pull_request_id}
{code}
fields.summary: Support for Pull request name and description Pipeline variable

fields.description: As a user of BitBucket, having to use Jira to submit feedback/suggestions is such a terrible experience.  How would I possibly know what components to select that are effected?  I'm just going to pick the first one in the list because I don't want to take the time to search and guess what the right component is.
fields.summary: Suggestions and Feedback

fields.description: The large status messages re: "Bitbucket Is Experiencing An Issue" fixed at the top of page is very annoying and in the way.  Be nice to find another place for it and be able to dismiss it.  It might be less intrusive if it didn't happen so ofter!
fields.summary: BitBucket Issue Status Message

fields.description:
In Bitbucket Server there is an option, with a plugin, to manually trigger a webhook such as to start a build in an external server (e.g. Jenkins)

Neither of the currently available triggers for a webhook is fit for my workflow thus having the ability to manually trigger the webhook would come in handy.
fields.summary: As a customer,  I want to be able to manually trigger a webhook

fields.description:
Currently, when you access the Bitbucket.org website in ASIA pacific region, sometimes you'll have a fairly good connection but sometimes not.

I believe one of the main reasons this is happening because of the location of the Bitbucket Cloud server (which is located in the US) while accessing from ASIA.

It would be great if we could have a server-based in ASIA to make the connection more stable and with consistent speed.
fields.summary: Allow Bitbucket.org CDN in ASIA pacific region

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A failed pipeline does not update the branch status to Failed if its “phase number” is lower than the last branch status

Because of this, the latest branch status is always Successful

When a pipeline that actually fixes the branch, it does not evaluate as First Successful (because the “previous” pipeline would be always SUCCESSFUL)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a pipeline with more than 1 step
# On first build, step 1 is successful and step 2 failed
# On second build, step 1 failed

h3. Expected Results
A failed notification is triggered

h3. Actual Results
Notification is not triggered 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Failed pipeline does not update the branch status to Failed if its “phase number” is lower than the last branch status

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The pull requests page is not loading itself after clicking the "Pull requests" menu item.
 This is quite confusing because you'll never know if the PR list is updated or not.
 For example, if you're on the PR list page and someone created a PR, the list will not be automatically updated in real-time, hence, you'll need to refresh the page manually in order to get the new updates.
 Some customers preferred to click the "Pull requests" menu item button but it is not loading the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Go to a repository
 # Click *Pull requests*
 # Click *Pull requests* again

h3. Expected Results

The page content will be refreshed or re-loaded
h3. Actual Results

The page content is not being refreshed or re-loaded
h3. Workaround

Refresh the entire page instead:
 * CTRL+R (Windows)
 * CMd+R (Mac)
fields.summary: Pull request menu doesn't load itself after clicking

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Email notifications for issue update have duplicate Version label
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add a version to an issue and the email notification received has duplicate version label

h3. Expected Results

There should be only one Version label
h3. Actual Results
!image-2020-10-20-18-22-43-445.png|width=990,height=137!
fields.summary: Issue email notification has duplicate word in version label

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a repository named workspace breaks the repository
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Repository named "workspace"
 # Go to Pull Request Screen -> It redirects you to the dashboard https://bitbucket.org/workspaceID/

h3. Expected Results

* Clicking on Pull Request should open up the Pull Request Screen

h3. Actual Results
* Redirect back to the dashboard

h3. Workaround

Rename the repository from workspace to another name. similar to "workspace-test" etc.
fields.summary: Creating a repository named workspace breaks the repository

fields.description:
Hello,
 For now if I type "find bug" in search textbox search returns all files where are this words in that order no matter where they are placed. I.e. file with text "find crtitical bug" will be 'valid' result.
 If I trying to find "skin/skin" phrase I will got many "trash" files where "skin" placed 2 times but not exact phrase.

Also it's useful to find exact method call with specifed parameters. As described in this (I think related to this task) discussion 3 years ago:

[Bitbucket Code Search EXACT method call|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Bitbucket-questions/Bitbucket-Code-Search-EXACT-method-call/qaq-p/601356]

So I suggest to add a way to search exact phrase matches.

*Example*:
 Let's say we have 3 source code files with texts:

1. " Skin [] skins = \{ new Skin (1), new Skin (2) } ".
 2. " Url = '//path/skin/skin/static' ".
 3. " We use skin generator to construct skin at runtime ".

*Do:*
 Type in search textbox: _"skin/skin"_

*Actual:* all 3 files are in the search result
 *Expected:* only file 2 are shown.
fields.summary: Exact phrase matching in code search

fields.description:
h2. An easy way for users 'not admin' check the repository size.

 

this is painful:

git clone <repo url> --mirror
cd <repo folder>
git count-objects -vH

only to check the repository size - single thing
fields.summary: Repository size

fields.description:
With the closure of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BCLOUD-19617,  we were introduced to this: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/importing-data-from-bitbucket-935384618.html] and [https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/export-issue-data-to-jira-cloud/] 

However, the attachments can only go through when you make the repository AND the issue tracker both public which raises potential security concerns. 
{quote}Attachments on the issue or on comments will only be exported if the repository and issue tracker are both public
{quote}
h3.  Suggestion

It would be worthwhile to consider to allow attachments to go through when migrating issues to Jira _*without*_ making the repo+issue tracker as public.
fields.summary: Allow attachments to go through when migrating issues to Jira from a private repository

fields.description:
Hi, it would be really helpful if the Build information ("1 of 1 passed", "0 of 1 passed") in the "/commits" view would update together with the "Date". I see the Date change automatically within each minute passes, so I guess this improvement can be done and it would really take some stress off my mind, having to update the page with F5 to know when I have the new version built.

 

Thanks in advance!
fields.summary: Update build info together with minute count

fields.description:
Currently, the member's section on Bitbucket Cloud workspaces displays all users that are a part of the workspace and it's visible to all users. 

Some organizations prefer to not display all users of a workspace.

The option to hide this section would help alleviate this issue.
fields.summary: Option to hide the members section on workspaces

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the commits page UI, if there's no Builds column, the commits table is not aligned and there are some excess spaces on the right side of the screen.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new repo
 # Push a commit or just create a README.md on BB UI
 # Go to commits page
 !commits_table_alignment.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

The commits table will be aligned without excess spaces
h3. Actual Results

The commits table is not aligned
h3. Workaround

There are a couple of workarounds available listed below. Please use one of the options below - 
 # Enable the Pipeline in the repository.  Once the Pipeline is enabled, there's the "Build" column, and the commits page UI will be aligned without excess spaces
 # Mouse over the commit message in the UI, the tooltip will show more number of characters of the commit message 
 # Click on the commit link and it will open a new UI having the details of that commit. This UI will give the entire commit message for the commit 
 # Zoom Out in the browser and it will display more number of characters of the commit message in the UI
fields.summary: The commits page table is not aligned if there is no Builds column

fields.description:
Right now, IP allowlisting is only available for private repositories. This request is to be able to have a public repository, that only allows certain IP's to access it.

 

The use-case is to be able to have a repository that users in your organization can access, without having to have a Bitbucket account that is granted access to the repository like you would have to with a private repository.
fields.summary: Ability to use IP Allowlisting on a public repository

fields.description: I have 270 repositories. To get a processable list, I have to wade through OAuth2 process and create a script. I would appreciate CSV export button on /dashboard/repositories or /foo/workspace/projects/BAR.
fields.summary: Repository CSV export

fields.description:
Hi Team,

We are seeking for a feature that allows a read-only user to get access to Audit logs for SOC compliance. Currently, only ADMIN privileged user has access to the audit logs.

There is no current known workarounds:
- No APIs

Users with Workspace admin privileges and no repository access is close to an option to be considered.
fields.summary: Ability for READ-ONLY user to gain access to Audit logs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Personal and shared workspaces handle repo settings (permission: create repository) differently.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a personal workspace
 2. Create a group in the personal workspace with the "create repository" permission
 3. Add another user to that group
 4. Log in as the user you added to the group
 5. Create a repo in the personal workspace
 6. You *will* *not* be able to administer the repo you just created

1. Create a shared workspace
 2. Create a group in the personal workspace with the "create repository" permission
 3. Add another user to that group
 4. Log in as the user you added to the group
 5. Create a repo in the shared workspace
 6. You *will* be able to administer (you can visit the settings page for the repo) the repo you just created
h3. Expected Results

Similar behavior the create repository permission in Personal and Shared workspace.
h3. Actual Results

For individual workspaces: the user will not be able to administer the workspace that was created
 For shared workspaces: the user will be able to administer the workspace that was created
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Personal and shared workspaces handle repo settings differently

fields.description: When editing a file in the Bitbucket Cloud text editor, I would like to have Word Wrap set on as a default. It doesn't generally make sense to have long lines not wrap.
fields.summary: Option to set Word Wrap on as default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While performing the integration with Jira, Bitbucket displays the wrong workspace name if it was changed after its creation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a workspace
 # Change its name on its settings page
 # Try to integrate it with a Jira instance

h3. Expected Results

Integration pop-up show the new Workspace name

 !image-2020-10-14-10-54-53-867.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

Integration pop-up show the old Workspace name

h3. Workaround

Currently, it is necessary to contact the support team so they can update the workspace name on the database.
fields.summary: While performing the integration with Jira Bitbucket display the wrong workspace name

fields.description:
Currently, Bitbucket Cloud only supports Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Internet Explorer, and Microsoft Edge, as per this documentation:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/which-browsers-does-bitbucket-support-296092232.html\\
It would be nice to add support for the Chrome Canary browser support to mitigate possible bugs caused by not having this browser tested as well.
fields.summary: Add support for Chrome Canary browser

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After renaming a repository and clicking the *Back* button, it doesn't update the clone URL's new repo name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an existing repository
# Click *Repository settings*
# Change the repo name
# Click the *Back* button on the left
# Click the *Clone* button on the right
# Notice the repo name is still the old one

h3. Expected Results
The clone repo URL should be updated upon clicking the *Back* button

h3. Actual Results
The clone repo URL is not being updated upon clicking the *Back* button

h3. Workaround

Upon clicking the *Back* button, kindly refresh the page before clicking the *Clone* button
fields.summary: Renaming a repository name doesn't update the Clone repo name

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Bitbucket Pipeline is unable to pull images as service from the Nexus registry
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Pull an image as service from Nexus registry in Bitbucket Pipeline
 The following error occurs -
{code:java}
failed to resolve reference "<Nexus registry name/Image name: Tag>": <Nexus registry name/Image name: Tag>: not found
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The image from the Nexus registry should be pulled as service without any issue in the Bitbucket Pipeline
h3. Actual Results

The image can not be pulled as service in the Bitbucket Pipeline
h3. Workaround

The nodes in our Kubernetes build cluster are being run with containerd rather than docker. It seems that recent versions of Nexus (at least 3.22 and 3.27) doesn't support containerd. Please [file a support ticket|https://support.atlassian.com/contact], to be excluded from our migration and consider raising a support ticket with Nexus to support containerd.
fields.summary: Unable to pull images as service from Nexus registry in Pipeline

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The merge/Edit button is not available in the Pull request in the *_New pull request experience_* view even the user has required repository/branch permission. The users are unable to View the Merge checks as well.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The issue is impacting only a few customers hence some of the users can reproduce the issue and some not.
 # Open a Pull request
 # You might not see Merge and Edit buttons in the Pull request

h3. Expected Results

Merge and Edit button should be visible to the user in the Pull request in *_New Pull request experience_* view
h3. Actual Results

Merge and Edit button are not visible to the user in the Pull request in _*New Pull request experience*_ view
h3. Workaround

View the Pull request in the *_Old Pull request experience_* view.

You will see the *_Help and feedback_* section on the lower right side of the Pull Request. That section has links to *_View this pull request in the old experience_*. Please click on this link and you should be able to view the Merge and Edit buttons
fields.summary: Merge/Edit button is not available in Pull request in New Pull request view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is unable to configure Wiki as a default landing page in the Repository
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Select _*Repository settings*_ of a repository 
 # Select _*Repository details*_ from the _*GENERAL*_ section from the left pane
 # Select the _*Advanced*_ section from the right side 
 # Select dropdown in the _*Default landing page*_ section
 # Observe that the _*Wiki*_ option is not available in the dropdown

h3. Expected Results

The *_Wiki_* option should be available in the dropdown for a user to select _*Wiki*_ as the default landing page
h3. Actual Results

The *_Wiki_* option is not available in the dropdown for a user to select _*Wiki*_ as the default landing page
h3. Workaround

User can select the Wiki page from the left side pane after the repository is accessed
fields.summary: Unable to set Wiki as default landing page in Repository

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While checking commit diffs, browsers find tool (command-F) doesn't work on text that has been highlighted by word diff

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Commit changes done to a line of code modifying only some sections of it
#* eg. from "code to diff" to "code on diff"
# Check the commit diff page

h3. Expected Results

Be able to search for "code to diff" and "code on diff" using the browser "find" tool

h3. Actual Results

"code on diff" is not being found by the browser "find" tool

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Browser find (command-F) doesn't work on text that has been highlighted by word diff

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The browser page favicon is broken:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-12 at 09.26.41.png|thumbnail! 

If you check the HTML of the page you can find this link element:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-12 at 09.24.14.png|thumbnail! 

but the file resource doesn't exists:
https://bitbucket.org/build-favicon-default.5ced79d9.ico/

h3. Steps to Reproduce

check above

h3. Expected Results

There should be some icon.

h3. Actual Results

Browser icon is missing.

h3. Workaround

# Bookmark a different page such as your profile home page, as this one will have the Bitbucket Favicon
# Use a browser extension/plugin that allows you to customize the icons of the websites in your bookmark bar.
fields.summary: The page favicon is broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After opening a pull request with a source and the destination branch, the target branch on the pull request is deleted. When trying to edit and update the target branch, users cannot do so, the destination branch option is greyed out with the following message "Repository must have at least one branch"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open a pull request (Let's say the source branch is Branch_A with a destination branch of Branch_B
# Delete Branch_B from the branches page
# Go back to the open pull request and edit the pull request
# On the pull request update page, destination branch drop-down is greyed out and contains the message "Repository must have at least one branch"

h3. Expected Results
* Should be able to select a new destination branch 

h3. Actual Results
* The option to select a new destination branch is not available 

h3. Workaround
* Decline the PR and recreate it with a new destination branch
* Recreated the deleted destination branch
fields.summary: Deleting a destination of a open pull request prevents users from editing and updating the destination branch on the pull request

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Transfering a repository to a personal workspace does not generate a notification to administrators.
Only the owner of the workspace is notified.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a repository
 # Go to its settings page
 # On the action button at the top right corner click on "Manage repository"
 # Select Transfer repository
 # Enter a workspaceID of a personal workspace

h3. Expected Results
A notification would be sent to all administrators of the workspace
h3. Actual Results
Only the owner of the workspace is notified.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Transfering a repository to a personal workspace does not generate a notification to administrators

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Right now, only repo admins can change the excluded files setting.

Can we all allow users with write access to change per pull request or even make it apart of Bitbucket user settings?

Or maybe a collapsed-by-default setting?

One of the issues that customers are facing is performance when large (often generated) files are not excluded or collapsed in a pull request by default.
fields.summary: Allow non-admins to exclude files in pull requests

fields.description:
As per the title, this feature request is to add Yarn cache to Bitbucket Pipelines as one of the default caches described here:
https://support.atlassian.com/bitbucket-cloud/docs/cache-dependencies/

At this moment, Yarn caches need to have the path manually set up.
fields.summary: Add Yarn cache support

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When forking a repository with "Allow only private forks" and immediately checking it's settings, sometimes, you will see the option as "Allow only forks".
 If the page is refreshed, the correct option is displayed.
 It is possible that it is browser-related (Chrome).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # *Fork* a repository
 # Select "Allow only private forks"
 # Click on Create
 # Go to the repository settings
 # Expand "Advanced"

h3. Expected Results

The forking option displayed should be "*Allow only private forks*"
h3. Actual Results

The forking option displays "*Allow forks*" the first time you open the settings page.
h3. Workaround

Refresh the page.
fields.summary: Creating a repository with "Allow only private forks" option defaults temporarily that option to "Allow forks"

fields.description:
The merge is taking longer than expected. The page will refresh once the merge has succeeded.
 
long time and does nothing.
fields.summary: Merge in progress

fields.description:
h1. Merge in progress
The merge is taking longer than expected. The page will refresh once the merge has succeeded.
 
does nothing.
fields.summary: Merge in progress

fields.description:
In order to understand the root cause of connection issues, we would like to have the option to set up the webhook history to be "active" by default.

This would allow us to better debug any issue related to this service.
fields.summary: Webhook history "Enable" by default

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Updating Credit card details on Bitbucket Cloud workspace says "There is no credit card on file"
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open your *Workspace settings* by clicking on*_Your profile and settings_ >* the name of the workspace, and then click *Settings* in the left sidebar.
 # Select *Plan details* under Plans and Billing on the left panel. You'll see your credit card details in the *Billing details* on the right side of your plan details.
 # Click *Update credit card*. If you haven't added your credit card yet, you'll see *Add credit card*.
You'll get the *Enter your billing details* screen.
 # On the *Enter, your billing details* screen, make the appropriate changes to your credit card details.

 # Click *Purchase*.

h3. Expected Results
credit card details updated successfully
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
There is no credit card on file
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround.
fields.summary: Updating Credit card details on Bitbucket Cloud workspace says "There is no credit card on file"

fields.description:
We are looking for an enhancement where the pipeline steps themselves can have some additional controls on who can trigger them.

As an example, the build step can be triggered by anyone in developers group and the deploy step on production can be triggered by only Operation group. Not sure if there are alternatives to do this, but this will be helpful for achieving our goal of separation of duties.
fields.summary: Provide granular controls on the Steps in Bitbucket Pipelines

fields.description: This feature request is to add the ability for Bitbucket to store Docker images, acting as a Docker registry.
fields.summary: Add image registry capabilities to Bitbucket

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Markdown failed to render properly if there are multiple lines within the code block

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Readme.md
 # Add the following markdown
{code}
# Test
    ```sh
    # Test
    # Test
    sudo apt install 

    # Test
    # Test
    sudo apt-get update
    ```
{code}

h3. Expected Results
The Markdown is properly render
h3. Actual Results
The markdown is not render properly

h3. Workaround
There Workaround is to split the code block into multiple part rather than one code block
fields.summary: Markdown failed to render properly if there are multiple lines within the code block

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Currently, if the user creates more than 50 JIRA issues in the Pull request it will only show the last 50 JIRA issues which also caused the link to be missing from the comment.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 51 JIRA issue from code comment
 # It will only show 50 JIRA issue and the latest one will disappear

h3. Expected Results
It should list out all 51 JIRA issue
h3. Actual Results
It only lists out the last 50 JIRA issue

h3. Workaround
There is no workaround available at this moment
fields.summary: Creating more than 50 JIRA issue in Pull request will only show the last 50 JIRA issue

fields.description:
This feature request is to add the ability to stop Pipelines from creating the build statuses at the end of the build.

Currently, we do have a way of managing these statuses through the API, here:
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Bworkspace%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commit/%7Bnode%7D/statuses/build

With that said, if you try to change the status programmatically through Pipelines, it will be overridden. With the implementation of this feature request, users will be able to change the build status only through Pipelines without worrying about Pipelines automatically overriding it.
fields.summary: Stop Pipelines from creating build statuses

fields.description: At the moment the list of repositories in a team or a project just shows if the repository builds.  Would it be possible to have the option of showing the Deployment status instead.
fields.summary: Summary of Repositories to have option of Deployment status
Warning before overwriting pull request

fields.description:
When you want to add a credit card information or update it, you have to go to:
Workspace Settings > Plan details > Update Credit Card

When you click on "Update Credit Card", a pop-up page load to change or add your billing information but the button at the bottom says "Purchase" rather than "Update" which misleads into getting billed to change this information. 

Please change the button name to convey a better understanding and experience to Bitbucket users.
fields.summary: Misleading naming convention for "Update Credit Card" information

fields.description:
Currently, only Billing and Technical contacts can view the past invoices in Bitbucket from https://my.atlassian.com. 

From a user perspective, it's not clear on how they can access their past invoices. 

Suggestion here is to include a link or a directive in the "Plan Details" screen in Bitbucket Cloud to redirect users to https://my.atlassian.com. If they are logged in as the Billing & Technical contact, they can view the Invoice for the account. We could also display the billing & tech contact so, admin's knows who to contact.
fields.summary: Ability to view or redirect users to https://my.atlassian.com to view Invoices from Bitbucket Admin view

fields.description: It would be great if pipeline build support multiple parallel steps in builds
fields.summary: Multiple steps in parllel builds

fields.description:
Hello Team,

It would be great if you can support other regions in Bitbucket pipelines 
in other AWS Regions like (ap-south-1) it can save lots of data transfer who are using Bitbucket for AWS project and push ECR images.
fields.summary: Bitbucket Pipeline in Another Regions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Currently, the Pull Request page affords one scroll bar to roll the diff part, and there is no scroll bar to scroll the files list on the right side of the page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a Pull request;
 # Check that there is just one scroll bar. 

h3. Expected Results

The customer expects that we include a scroll bar to turn better visible from the computer view and the tablet view. 
h3. Actual Results

The file list still being scrollable even without the scroll bar. 
h3. Workaround

Use the mouse, touchpad, or  arrow-keys to scroll
fields.summary: Include a Scroll bar to scroll the files list on a PR

fields.description: Is there a way to schedule a pipeline on a monthly basis?  I only see daily, hourly, and weekly.
fields.summary: Schedule Pipelines - Monthly intervals

fields.description: When cloning a repo also clone PR's making it possible to have a full back up of the repository if one needs to try some risky operations within it.
fields.summary: Possibility to Clone existing PR's when doing a clone of the Repository

fields.description:
*Problem:*

In the company that im working for we are creating a docker registry using gcloud container registry and the better way to authenticate this is via a json file that contains 2 private tokens and to do this my *solution* was:

Create a json template.json, run a nodejs script to get 2 env variables containing the tokens, put that file as artifact and use it in another step to execute the gcloud auth and push the docker image to the container registry. I could use SED for this but still it should be a unecessary step if we could have variables as files.
fields.summary: Ability to have a file as repository variable

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The admin users are unable to add groups in the branch permissions in repositories in certain workspaces. Only the workspaces which have a different Bitbucket user name and Workspace ID in the system are impacted.

The condition for this issue to trigger is when the branch permission contains a group in either the "write access" or "merge via pull request" fields.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a workspace, navigate to the repository > Repository settings > branch permissions
 # When adding new branch permission, on the "Write access" or "Merge via pull request" fields, add a user group
 # If you try to save, you will see the following error message:
{code:java}
group not found: <groupname>
{code}

h3. Expected Results

The branch permissions settings should work, allowing the admin to add a group to the branch permission.
h3. Actual Results

The below error message is thrown when a group is present in the branch permission being added:
{code:java}
group not found: <groupname>
{code}
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround currently available. We will update the ticket with a workaround as soon as available
fields.summary: Branch permission creation by admin is denied if a group is added on workspaces

fields.description:
Bitbucket GUI has a "sync now" button to sync the branches as shown in the below screenshot.

!image-2020-09-29-17-31-04-619.png|width=515,height=221!

However, there is no REST API endpoint to perform the same operation.

Please provide a REST API endpoint to perform the branch sync as in the GUI.

Note: I do not merge the pull request, just sync the branch.
fields.summary: Please provide an API endpoint to sync branches as in Bitbucket GUI

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Comment on a Pull request is in "Sending" status when the destination branch is deleted
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Add a comment on a pull request and the comment is in "Sending" status under the following scenarios:

1) Source branch is deleted
Destination branch is deleted
*Bug is reproducible*

2) Source branch exists
Destination branch is deleted
*Bug is reproducible*
h3. Expected Results
Comment should be added successfully
h3. Actual Results
!image-2020-09-28-13-14-30-834.png|width=372,height=125!
h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Comment on a Pull request is in "Sending" status when the destination branch is deleted

fields.description:
Submitting this ticket for a feature request consideration to have a feature that would help merge two separate Bitbucket Cloud workspaces into one. 

Currently, we have repository transfers. 

Ideally, these would be the areas we would be looking at:
* Repository Movement in Bulk. 
* User/Permission Movement. 

This would help Organisations that are merging at a large scale.
fields.summary: Merge Workspaces

fields.description:
Currently when you open PR review and want to see changes, the file you selected is always cut to places where changes are. But, to understand the change, in most cases, it's require to see the context, the full scope of the file. Using expansion dots is very tedious and get. too much time. 
As a user and programmer I want to see changes in a full scope, see the whole file by default or have an option to turn it on, and not going to the option menu (".../View entire file") where it's possible to open full file preview in overlay popup.
fields.summary: Full file text in PR review by default (or option in settings)

fields.description:
The cards that appear on the Deployments page show only the Pipeline number, commit short hash, commit message, time, and initiator (if not automatic).

Ideally, it would be nice to have at least one field that could be populated during the deployment step to expose custom text. The main motivator for this feature request (for me) is to be able to show a version number, but I can definitely find a purpose for any freeform text.
fields.summary: Custom Deployment Card Text
Error importing Bitbucket Issues to Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is unable to delete project having Mercurial repositories and receive the following error - 
"You cannot delete this project because it still contains repositories. To delete the project you must first move or delete any repositories."
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Delete a project having Mercurial repositories

h3. Expected Results

The project should be deleted without any issue
h3. Actual Results

The project doesn't get deleted and the user receives the following error - 
"You cannot delete this project because it still contains repositories. To delete the project you must first move or delete any repositories."
h3. Workaround

Create a new project and continue using that. You can also raise a Support ticket and they will help you to delete the Mercurial repositories.
fields.summary: Unable to delete project having Mercurial repositories

fields.description: Seeing 3rd party integrations providing this (e.g. https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1221851/integration-with-jetbrains-ides?hosting=cloud&tab=overview), but a native connector similar to https://www.atlassian.com/blog/jira-software/jira-software-and-bitbucket-in-vs-code would be nice!
fields.summary: Native Integration with JetBrains IDE's

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users are not able to download xml/txt files via latest chrome version
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # "Open raw-> right click-> save as" 
 # Open the downloaded file and you should be able to see an error attached below

h3. Actual Results

"error on line # at column #"
h3. Expected Results

File content should be downloaded successfully
h3. Workaround

You can successfully download files on Safari and Firefox
fields.summary: Cannot download Raw files via Chrome Browser

fields.description:
I would like a "add default reviewers" button on the "Edit pull request" page.

My workflow is usually to create a pull request with no reviewers, so that I can review it myself and add any needed comments. Once it is ready for review, I want to be able to easily add the default reviewers.
fields.summary: Easily add default reviewers to existing PR

fields.description:
Jira already has a similar feature which is described on this page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-jira-cloud-to-send-emails-on-behalf-of-your-domain-979428371.html

The business case would be to be able to be able to apply more secure restrictions over received emails and prevent phishing attempts.

As a suggestion, implement this feature within the workspace settings so that the setup can be different according to the project you are working on.
fields.summary: Allow to configure a standard email sender for Bitbucket Cloud notifications

fields.description:
Bitbucket's issue tracker doesn't have the ability to change the issue reporter like Jira does.
This feature request is to add this ability in the UI.
fields.summary: Add the ability to change the issue reporter on the issue tracker.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Images added in comments in PR/Issues are not visible/broken in email notifications
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add an image in the issue(BB issue tracker) comments section or a PR comment
 # the image is broken/not visible in the email notification received by watchers
 # tested in Chrome/Safari/Mozilla

h3. Expected Results
The image along with the comment text should be visible
h3. Actual Results
!image-2020-09-24-15-36-28-299.png|width=262,height=141!
h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Images added in comments in PR/Issues are not visible in email notifications

fields.description:
Currently, if you use the feature [Conditional step|https://bitbucket.org/blog/conditional-steps-and-improvements-to-logs-in-bitbucket-pipelines] and all steps are stopped because it does not meet the required changesets, the entire Pipelines build will be marked as a *successful* build even though the there is no step that was run.

*How to replicate?*
Use the below YAML configuration:
{code:java}
pipelines:
  default:
    - step:
        name: Step 1
        condition:
            changesets:
                includePaths:
                    - "some_directory_here/**"
        script:
          - echo "Step 1 - Script"
    - step:
        name: Step 2
        condition:
            changesets:
                includePaths:
                    - "some_directory_here/**"
        script:
          - echo "Step 2 - Script"
    - step:
        name: Step 3
        condition:
            changesets:
                includePaths:
                    - "some_directory_here/**"
        script:
          - echo "Step 3 - Script"
{code}

I believe this is expected as the *condition* feature only checks the condition at a step level, not at the global level or the entire Pipelines build itself.

*Enhancement request:*
At some point, the entire Pipelines build will be confusing as it is marked as a "Successful" build even though none of the steps are run.
Hence, it would be very useful if we either not run a Pipelines build completely if all steps are stopped using the *condition* feature or change the status of the entire Pipelines build to "Stopped".
fields.summary: Pipelines Condition feature on step level

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, when creating a new repository, the default option to include a .gitignore is "Yes". 
 !Feature.png|width=314,height=335!
h3. Suggested Solution

When creating a new repository, the default option to include a .gitignore should be “No” or include an option to set the default value.
h3. Workaround

You can manually change the "Include .gitignore?" option to "No".
fields.summary: Change default “Include .gitignore?” option when creating a new repository to “No”

fields.description: With the current environment, many are moving to having their default branch be named "main" instead of "master". By default when we create a repository in bitbucket, the default branch is named "master". Could we be given an option to change this at repository creation time?
fields.summary: Create Repository give option to give name to default branch

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
PR Preview does not load on PR comments if IP Whitelisting is enabled. 
Preview loads with "You don't have access to this link. Try another account"

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable IP Whitelist in the workspace
 # On one PR comments section, add the link to another PR

h3. Expected Results
# A preview containing the linked PR title is rendered.

h3. Actual Results
# Error message "You don't have access to this link. Try another account".
# When you click the link, it goes through the id.atlassian.com login flow and back to the PR page. Still shows error.

h3. Workaround
# Disable IP Whitelist from the worskpace.
fields.summary: PR Preview does not load on PR comments if IP Whitelisting is enabled

fields.description:
A request to the configured upstream server failed because the response was unexpected. (Status code: 403, message: 'Forbidden')
-----------------------
Please provide a feature to define alert when upstream server sync failure. 

Thanks,
Vissa
fields.summary: Alert - Notification - Upstream server sync errors

fields.description:
Please send notification when public key or ssh key issues arises in sync.  
As it is handled by mirror server , this can be a doable task. 

Thanks,
Vissa
fields.summary: Sync Errors - Alert User - Permission denied (publickey)

fields.description:
Please send us an alert notification when 
1. mirror link is down.  
2. mirror link is flapping.

Currently BB cloud assumes mirror link will be online always. 

Thanks,
Vissa
fields.summary: Alert - Notification - Mirror is down.

fields.description:
There is a fast possibility to add a comment on a line directly in the commit view.

I mean comment adding on page like: https://bitbucket.org/[user]/[repo]/commits/[commit hash]

The visible code is wrapped by default - limited view to changes from the commit. If we unwrap the code using `... ` icon (Show more lines), we will be able to add a comment on any line, not related to visible changes as well.
Nevetheless, if we refresh the page (or send url to a developer), the code is wrapped again and the previously added comment is not visible. We have to click `...` icon (Show more lines) what is not intuitive.

The view should be limited to changes from the commit and all lines with any comments.
fields.summary: Show all comments in a commit changes view

fields.description:
When I go to "User and groups access" for either a repository or a workspace it shows the lists of users, but I see 2 identical users for myself that I cannot distinguish between because they only show avatar plus name. 

 

One of those users is my personal email address and account and the other is my company account. So I can't tell which account to remove/restrict access from.

 

It would be really helpful if it also showed the email address for the account.
fields.summary: Unable to distinguish between personal and company accounts

fields.description:
It's nowadays possible to have docker machines to build windows native code in C++.

The current build of our company really would benefit from this.

 

For now, we use a GG cross-compiler based docker images for pipelines but this is far from catching all we would like in a pipeline. MSVS is not GCC...

 

Can someone just look into the commercial potential for Premium plan users of Bitbucket ?

Technically it's really easy see: [https://devblogs.microsoft.com/cppblog/using-msvc-in-a-docker-container-for-your-c-projects/]

 

Only need someone at Atlassian upper management to think it's worth it so windows docker machine are provisioned from Azure (cf: https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/services/kubernetes-service/docker/)

 

Honestly if this is not done I would really recommend my company and all my work entourage to stop using Bitbucket at all since there are other alternatives far more capable.

 

NOTE: This is NOT a duplicate of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BCLOUD-13452 but solving this would automatically solve other issue. .NET app are easy to build on Linux dockers without issues.
fields.summary: Support for native Windows (mainly for C++ docker machines)

fields.description:
########################

PM Update (May 2021)

We are working on introducing Project Permissions and Settings in 2021. This will change how many things are configured in Bitbucket today.
 * We plan to change who can transfer a repository based on project permissions
 * We plan to change who can create projects and repos within projects
 * Setting configurations at project level removes need to change settings on every repository.

Adding new roles to Bitbucket has been discussed but we are not focusing on adding anything until we have changed the current model to support projects

#########################

 

It would be good if there were more granular options for defining user roles for workspaces and repositories. Right now, at the repository level you can have "Read", "Write", or "Admin" permissions. But it would be nice if you had more control/granularity over this so you can have users who can control _some_ repository settings, but not all.

 

For example, some users would want to be able to allow users to manage repository settings like webhooks, or branch permissions, but wouldn't want to allow users to be able to delete or transfer the repository. Right now, the only way a user can manage repository settings like webhooks or branch permissions for example is if they have admin access to the repository, but that also allows them to delete or transfer the repository.

 Edit by [~0298b2749e0b]: It would also be great to add this granularity to the Workspace level access. At the moment, users are only able to create projects if they have workspace administrative access, which would also allow them to update the workspace name, plan, groups...

Edit by [~fstefanelli@atlassian.com]: Following the same granular logic permission, add the possibility to grant or restrict access to specific branches and/or files.

Edit by [~gmarcolino+atlassian_conflict]: Following the granular logic permission, add the ability to restrict which users can be listed as Pull Request reviewers.

Edit by [~gmarcolino+atlassian_conflict]: Following the granular logic permission, add the ability to restrict which users can create/manage projects.
fields.summary: More granular Repository User permissions (e.g. Custom Roles)

fields.description:
A feature to have the Add Members button *resend invitations* to users who have not accepted the invitation properly will help admins move through the UI quicker
 !image-2020-09-18-19-05-47-509.png!

Rather than opening the group and resending it.

Regards
fields.summary: Resending Invitations to New Bitbucket Users

fields.description:
h2. {{*Description*}}

When we are creating a new pull request, this page instantly loads the difference between two branches, which most of the time are not the ones you really want to create the PR.

Sometimes the difference between one branch and the other is very large and once done you will have to change the branchs again, wasting time.

 
h2. *{{Solution}}*

So I believe that it would be ideal to have a button to calculate the difference, or start with the two selects in the same branch, so that there is no difference and load quickly. For example when you open the page the selects are on the same branch (dev-> dev).

Another nice thing would be to be able to pass the comparison branches through Query Parameters. So when you load the page it will already load with the correct branches and even make it easier if you want to share it with someone else. Just pass the link with the query parameters.
fields.summary: Pull request view lazy load

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition 
Currently, when the repository is over 5 GB, the error message doesn't specify that, the error message is "Repository is in read-only mode (over 2 GB size limit)". 
So the user tries to undo the last push to bring the size below the 2.0 GB limit and remove the push restriction. However, when the repository is over 5 GB, it won't work. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Bitbucket should show a different error message indicating that the repository is above 5.0 GB all changes will be rejected. You will need to raise a support request to get help reducing the size of your repository.
fields.summary: Change the error message when the repository is over 5 GB

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The issue key in the branch name does not link to the Jira issue if the branch name has another pattern like the Jira issue key.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate Bitbucket with Jira instance.
 # Create an issue in Jira, lets say NEW-1
 # Create a branch in Bitbucket with the issue key in the branch name, lets say *NEW-1_test-1*
 # Make a commit on the branch, create PR, and merge the branch.
 # In the commits page, you can see that the Jira issue key in the branch name does not link to the Jira issue.
 # It works fine if the branch name does not contain any other number in the issue key format. Example: branch name *NEW-1_test* works fine

!image-2020-09-17-18-32-18-905.png|width=1357,height=123!
h3. Expected Results

The Jira issue key in the branch name should link to the Jira issue.
h3. Actual Results

The Jira issue key in the branch name does not link to the Jira issue.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Issue key in the branch name does not link to the Jira issue if the branch name has another pattern like the Jira issue key

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When creating a new branch from a Jira Software issue the "From branch" selected is not respected in Bitbucket Cloud. The From branch defaults back to the main branch i.e. Master

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Jira Software create a branch from an issue
# Under the 'From branch' section select a branch other than the default main branch i.e master
# Click create
# You're then redirected the branches page in Bitbucket Cloud and the from branch you selected earlier is reverted to the main branch i.e master

h3. Expected Results
* The branch should be the same From branch that was selected

h3. Actual Results
* The branch defaults back to the main branch

h3. Workaround
* Manually select the branch when redirected to the branch page in Bitbucket Cloud
fields.summary: Creating a new Branch from Jira Software was defaults the 'From branch' to the main branch in Bitbucket Bucket Cloud

fields.description:
When you hit the checkout button on a branch, it gives the default commands shown with the `&&` symbols separating them. Window's PowerShell requires a `;` between consecutive commands as shown. 
It would be great if their was a user/repo based setting to default to the semicolon behavior.

!https://i.imgur.com/VowJtgp.png!

!https://i.imgur.com/YzaV5uN.png!
fields.summary: Bitbucket Checkout flow incompatible with Window's Powershell
